qas.question: Which states do MLB teams do spring training in?
What is the MLB preseason league in Arizona called?
What is the MLB preseason league in Florida called?
How many preseason games does each MLB team play?
What is it called when an MLB team plays two preseason games in one day with different rosters?

How many preseason games are played against minor league teams?
What is it called when a team placed two games in the same day with the same roster?
What type of games are sometimes played against high school or local college teams?

context: The Major League Baseball's preseason is also known as <b5_0>spring training<b5_0/>. <b6_0>All MLB teams<b6_0/> maintain a spring-training base in <a0_0>Arizona or Florida<a0_0/>. The teams in Arizona make up the <a1_0>Cactus League<a1_0/>, while the teams in Florida play in the <a2_0>Grapefruit League<a2_0/>. Each team plays <a3_0>about <b7_0>30<a3_0/> preseason games<b7_0/> against other MLB teams. They may also play <b9_0>exhibitions<b9_0/> against a local college team or a minor-league team from their farm system. Some days feature the team playing two games with two different rosters evenly divided up, which are known as <a4_0><b8_0>"split-squad"<b8_0/> games<a4_0/>.
